body: Is this going through the same runfiles / executable combination again and again for you? Is it worth caching the check?
We do use the merkle tree cache already ( and a pretty big one, too, currently standing at 10k entries )

issue.title: Add executable to stateful runfiles if necessary

labels.name: team-Configurability
labels.description: platforms, toolchains, cquery, select(), config transitions

repository.name: bazel
repository.description: a fast, scalable, multi-language and extensible build system

issue.body:
This is already being done in the stateless case and avoids a costly check that used to flatten the runfiles tree.

In fact, the check was not sufficient as it also considered the executable to be present if it is the target of a custom symlink - but both test actions and dependents using location expansion assume that the executable is present in its default location. A new test verifies these cases.

Fixes #26242

issue.body:
This is already being done in the stateless case and avoids a costly check that used to flatten the runfiles tree.

In fact, the check was not sufficient as it also considered the executable to be present if it is the target of a custom symlink - but both test actions and dependents using location expansion assume that the executable is present in its default location. A new test verifies these cases.

Fixes #26242

Closes #26246.
